newsitem.title: CHINA: China's monks, nuns to pray for HK's prosperity.
newsitem.headline: China's monks, nuns to pray for HK's prosperity.

text.p: About 1,000 Buddhist monks and nuns will hold rites in central China next week to pray for the prosperity of Hong Kong, which reverts to Beijing rule on July 1, the People's Daily Overseas Edition said on Tuesday.
The ceremonies will be held at Bishan Temple on Wutaishan Mountain -- one of China's four most sacred Buddhist sites -- in the central province of Shanxi on June 28, the newspaper said.
Monks and nuns will "pray for luck...and a better tomorrow for the motherland", which is due to resume sovereignty over the British colony of Hong Kong at midnight on June 30, it said.
